article.headline: Drexel 66, Towson 60
article.story: TOWSON, Md. (AP) -- Reserve Kenell Sanchez scored 17 points to lead Drexel to a 66-60 victory over Towson on Monday night, the Tigers' 12th straight loss. Chaz Crawford had seven points and 10 rebounds for Drexel (17-10, 12-6 Colonial Athletic Association), while Bashir Mason added 11 points. The win was the fourth straight for the Dragons, who will play Hofstra on Saturday in the CAA tournament quarterfinals. Trevan Jackson scored 12 points for Towson (5-23, 2-16), while Lawrence Hamm had 13 rebounds. Towson will play Delaware in the CAA's first round on Friday. Jackson hit consecutive 3-pointers to bring Towson within 56-51 with 3:52 to play. Sanchez then scored all the points in a 5-0 run and Towson didn't get closer than four points the rest of the way.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
